flashcards.english: Wendo (love), Ûrûme (bravery), Ûtukû (night), Ûrîmû (foolishness), Watho (law), Ûtihû (face), Ûîru (jealousy), Ûthamaki (kingdom), Ûgeni (visit), Ûgo (magic), Ûrogi (witchcraft)
flashcards.notes: Class 7 nouns represent abstract concepts - emotions, states, supernatural, governance. No prefix, typically start with 'û' or 'w'

flashcards.english: Thuruarĩ nguhĩ (shorts), Thuruarĩ ndaihu (trousers), Mûthurũ (skirt), Caatĩ (shirt), Mburauthĩ (blouse), Nguo ya thĩinĩ (underwear), Gĩtambaya kĩa mûtwe (headscarf), Thogithĩ (socks), Kĩratũ (shoe)
flashcards.notes: Complete clothing vocabulary including: Kĩratũ gĩa kobo (gum boots), Kĩratũ gĩa taritarĩ (slippers), Kĩratũ kĩa mûtheece (high heels)

flashcards.english: Mûthûa (termites), Thigiriri (small black ants), Thuraku (soldier ants in line), Mûgagaca (tiny brown ants in groups)
flashcards.notes: Gîthûa (termite mound). Question: Mûthûa ni mwega? (Are termites good?) - culturally termites are eaten as delicacy

flashcards.english: Wee (you), Niĩ (me), Mbere (before/first), Heho (cold), Mwaki (fire), We (he/she), Mũrĩmi (farmer), Ndingĩhota (I cannot)
flashcards.notes: Translation pairs from Swahili to Kikuyu. Note: 'Wee' has long vowel, 'We' has short vowel

flashcards.english: Ndûiga (giraffe), Njogu (elephant), Wambûi mîcore/Njagî (zebra), Nyaga (ostrich), Huria (rhino), Mûrûthî (lion), Ngatata (wildebeest), Nyûtû (cheetah), Hiti (hyena), Nguuo (hippo), Ngarî (leopard), Thakwe (chimpanzee)
flashcards.notes: Complete wild animal vocabulary - 12 major African wildlife species

flashcards.english: Mūrathimi (the one who blesses), Rīu rī (now - at statement beginning), Wakwa (mine - depending on noun class), Ciakwa (mine - plural)
flashcards.notes: Shows noun class agreement with possessives: wakwa vs ciakwa. Rīu rī used as discourse marker
